pros:
Health benefits were generous. 
Vacation
Working from home flexibility was generous.
cons:
The company went downhill, fast. Despite increased government funding, engagement plummeted. Mitacs isn't about Canadian innovation anymore, nor is it about the bridge between academia and industry. No, Mitacs sole focus is to pump out as much social justice warrior rhetoric to it's employees at every opportunity, and hope that makes employees feel good about working there.

Extremely weak executives. 
Sickening pay. 
Nepotism.


Avoid, avoid, avoid

pros: Friendly team and company culture, great mandate, reasonable pay

pros: Mitacs mission is unique to support innovation
cons: Low salary, high expectations. You should work 60 hrs a week

review_title: Great people stuck in a weird set-up
pros: Loved the people I worked with! You will never run into so many great people under one roof. Also, Mitacs is doing something that no other organization in Canada is doing and organizational goals are selfless - the only goal is to help make Canada better. It was very inspirational knowing that you are a part of it.
cons: Salaries are lagging industry standards, even some non-profit standards, while quantity and quality of work expected is at the industry level. Sometimes organizational goals get in the way of people and run them over. Even though it is unintentional, it becomes hard to deal with.

review_title: Excellent organization, fun position with an inspiring mandate
job_title: Business Development Specialist in Toronto, ON
pros:
*I wanted a position that incorporated my interest in research, sales, entrepreneurship, and innovation. I have found that in my role at Mitacs. 
*Incredible support from colleagues across the country
*Fair compensation with excellent work-life balance.
*Inspiring mandates - help create experience for graduate students, and encourage R&D in Canada
*This is truthfully my dream job. I have been working at the organization for over a year and I haven't lost an ounce of my enthusiasm from day 1.
*Well-established SMART goals. Strong understanding of expectation. 
*Work with very intelligent, professional, and friendly colleagues.
cons: *I do not currently have any criticisms. I have yet to have a bad day at work.

pros:
- The organization has a goal of promoting R&D within Canada.
 - The possibility of advancement internally exists.
 - The organization has a way of attracting passionate, engaged talent.
cons:
- Management style is nearly a cult of personality surrounding the CEO.
 - Too much middle management: some departments have a 1:1 manager/employee ratio.
 - Salaries far below industry (and even nonprofit) standard.
 - No respect for work/life balance
 - Management has been caught lying outright from time to time

pros: I love it here!  People are really trying to make a difference in Canada.  It is nice to work with a well educated, dedicated workforce.  Everyone is very polite and kind.  People are encouraging and as a smaller organization, you have the chance to make a real impact internally and externally to the organization.
cons: A bit of a higher salary would be nice to be competitive with other similar organizations.

review_title: Management stuck in time , Future is bright
pros: Some of the people are awesome, mandate is good, new CEO is wonderful, HR is great and there Is hope for better
cons: Management level can appear to be incompetent and extremely bureaucratic. E.g the long time management group in Finance exemplifies incompetence and complacency ( the newer managers are awesome though),  programs team is unstable and does not provide clear value, Grant team is always struggling under really poor leadership.

review_title: Great mandate and a difficult place to work
pros:
Programs are making a difference 
Mandate and mission of organization is sound 
Good benefits package and flexibility
Young people 





Xxxxxx
cons:
Too bureaucratic and conflict with in snr management team a real proble 
Systems not well developed 
Growth of core programs while trying to do new things caused stress. Focus is lacking. 
Management problems and promotion of the wrong people 
Was good. Slipping to poor. People all looking for new jobs. Morale problems.

pros:
Only benefits really! 
There are some good people but most of them leave after about a year. Is very toxic for long-term.
cons:
Constant pressure. Impossible to maintain an adequate work-life balance. Immediate finance management are bullies, not leaders. Super high staff turnover. Overtime is expected but never paid! Has no one ever filed a complaint to BC Labour Standards?

Incompetent management in Grants, Finance and Admin. Business Development, Marketing and research is fairly good.

review_title: Horrible culture in finance team and lack of senior leadership
pros:
Friendly co-workers, who try really hard. 
Social events.
Healthcare benefits.
cons:
Unmanageable workload, unreasonable expectations. 
Only worked here for over a year- witnessed huge turnover rate in finance team. 
Lack of management direction, can't seem to agree on priorities. 
Because of lack of direction, team members who are left are understaffed, working nonstop to meet unrealistic demands. 
Low morale across team. 
Toxic work environment. 
HR/upper management, needs to urgently do something about culture. 
False and empty promises from management, with no follow up.

review_title: Great opportunity to conduct industrial research
job_title: Mitacs Elevate Postdoctoral Fellow in Vancouver, BC
pros: - This fellowship offers a unique opportunity to conduct research in an industrial environment.
cons: - As an industrial postdoctoral fellow, the duration of projects is shorter than in an academic setting. This can be a good thing if you enjoy moving fast, or a con if you enjoy being a deep diver into the research.

review_title: Not worth your time, company culture needs improvement
pros: Comprehensive healthcare benefits. Good office location in Vancouver.
cons:
HR needs to take gender discrimination complaints more seriously and have formal review process, instead of no action. 
Hours are long, overtime on weekends is standard.
Certain manager in finance department is difficult to work with, and he has created a toxic culture with high turnover rate - reason why I left.
Too much bureaucracy.

pros: It connects industries with school. It makes the intern combined with research and industrial use.
cons: You have to do some paper works to apply for the intern and the reviewing processes takes long time. You should know what you are going to do before coming to the company.

pros:
- nice co-workers
- positive mission 
- slightly above average pay for the non-profit sector
cons:
- incompetent management of the policy team, with lack of interest in producing quality output
- slow, bureaucratic environment, where little gets done 
- no direction in producing policy or innovation research
- policy analysts spend most of their time writing donor reports

pros: A lot of social gatherings
